name: Split Essentially Surjective Functor
definition: A **Functor** $F:C\to D$ is **split essentially surjective** if for every object $Y$ in $D$, there exists an object $X$ in $C$ and an isomorphism $F(X) \cong Y$ in $D$ such that the isomorphism is split (i.e., there is a chosen inverse).
description: A #functor is split essentially surjective if every object in $D$ is isomorphic to the image of some object in $C$ with a chosen inverse.
